text: For example, we assumed that the two ribosomal subunits had to separate for successful protein synthesis.

We can also use Ribo-T to create the first ever fully independent ribosome mRNA system in cells, where mRNA decoding, catalysis of polypeptide synthesis, and protein excretion can be optimized for new substrates and functions.
We share a fascination with this molecular machine, and only through interdisciplinary science at the boundaries of traditional disciplines could we pursue the adventure that led to Ribo-T.
We can now ask previously unanswerable questions about ribosome function.
Achieving these goals, however, requires the constant invention of new technologies.
This opens a transformational new direction in biomolecular engineering and synthetic biology.
Chapter 12 describes these technologies and explores how they are used.
with Shura [Alexander Mankin], as he is one of the world’s experts on the ribosome.
Ribo-T proves this assumption is inaccurate.
What potential uses do you envision for this technology?
he science of biotechnology uses living organisms or their products to improve human health or to perform specific industrial or manufacturing processes.
